meanings.sent1: The dog left some doodoos in the yard.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up after your pet's doodoos.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped in the doodoos while walking in the park.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the doodoos filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The toddler proudly showed off his doodoos to his parents.

meanings.sent1: His doodoos at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Stop with the silly doodoos and focus on your work.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's doodoos had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't help but giggle at his doodoos.
meanings.sent5: Their doodoos always brightened up the mood.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment or affection
meanings.sent1: She hugged her friend and said, 'I missed you, my little doodoos.'
meanings.sent2: Grandma always calls me her little doodoos.
meanings.sent3: The couple's pet names for each other included 'sweet doodoos.'
meanings.sent4: The siblings shared a special bond, often using 'doodoos' as a term of endearment.
meanings.sent5: The child's eyes lit up when called 'doodoos' by their favorite teacher.
